attributes.doc: Value is 'Image stack recorded from 2-photon microscope'
attributes.name: help

attributes.doc: Photomultiplier gain
attributes.name: pmt_gain

attributes.doc: Lines imaged per second. This is also stored in /general/optophysiology but is kept here as it is useful information for analysis, and so good to be stored w/ the actual data.
attributes.name: scan_line_rate

attributes.doc: Human-readable comments about the TimeSeries. This second descriptive field can be used to store additional information, or descriptive information if the primary description field is populated with a computer-readable string.
attributes.name: comments

attributes.doc: Description of TimeSeries
attributes.name: description

datasets.doc: Width, height and depth of image, or imaged area (meters).
datasets.name: field_of_view

groups.doc: A special case of optical imaging.

links.doc: link to ImagingPlane group from which this TimeSeries data was generated
links.name: imaging_plane

attributes.doc: Value is 'ROI responses over an imaging plane. Each element on the second dimension of data[] should correspond to the signal from one ROI'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: ROI responses over an imaging plane. Each element on the second dimension of data[] should correspond to the signal from one ROI

attributes.doc: Human-readable comments about the TimeSeries. This second descriptive field can be used to store additional information, or descriptive information if the primary description field is populated with a computer-readable string.
attributes.name: comments

attributes.doc: Description of TimeSeries
attributes.name: description

attributes.doc: Scalar to multiply each element in data to convert it to the specified unit
attributes.name: conversion

attributes.doc: Smallest meaningful difference between values in data, stored in the specified by unit. COMMENT: E.g., the change in value of the least significant bit, or a larger number if signal noise is known to be present. If unknown, use -1.0
attributes.name: resolution

attributes.doc: The base unit of measure used to store data. This should be in the SI unit. COMMENT: This is the SI unit (when appropriate) of the stored data, such as Volts. If the actual data is stored in millivolts, the field 'conversion' below describes how to convert the data to the specified SI unit.
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Signals from ROIs
datasets.name: data

datasets.doc: a dataset referencing into an ROITable containing information on the ROIs stored in this timeseries
datasets.name: rois

groups.doc: ROI responses over an imaging plane. Each row in data[] should correspond to the signal from one ROI.

attributes.doc: Value is 'Df/f over time of one or more ROIs. TimeSeries names should correspond to imaging plane names'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Df/f over time of one or more ROIs. TimeSeries names should correspond to imaging plane names

groups.doc: dF/F information about a region of interest (ROI). Storage hierarchy of dF/F should be the same as for segmentation (ie, same names for ROIs and for image planes).
RoiResponseSeries object containing dF/F for a ROI

attributes.doc: Value is 'Fluorescence over time of one or more ROIs. TimeSeries names should correspond to imaging plane names'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Fluorescence over time of one or more ROIs. TimeSeries names should correspond to imaging plane names

groups.doc: Fluorescence information about a region of interest (ROI). Storage hierarchy of fluorescence should be the same as for segmentation (ie, same names for ROIs and for image planes).
RoiResponseSeries object containing fluorescence data for a ROI

attributes.doc: Value is 'Stores groups of pixels that define regions of interest from one or more imaging planes'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Stores groups of pixels that define regions of interest from one or more imaging planes

groups.doc: Stores pixels in an image that represent different regions of interest (ROIs) or masks. All segmentation for a given imaging plane is stored together, with storage for multiple imaging planes (masks) supported. Each ROI is stored in its own subgroup, with the ROI group containing both a 2D mask and a list of pixels that make up this mask. Segments can also be used for masking neuropil. If segmentation is allowed to change with time, a new imaging plane (or module) is required and ROI names should remain consistent between them.

attributes.doc: Value is 'Results from segmentation of an imaging plane'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Results from segmentation of an imaging plane

attributes.doc: The names of the columns in this table. This should be used to specifying an order to the columns
attributes.name: colnames

attributes.doc: Description of what is in this dynamic table
attributes.name: description

datasets.doc: ROI masks for each ROI. Each image mask is the size of the original imaging plane (or volume) and members of the ROI are finite non-zero
datasets.name: image_mask

datasets.doc: index into pixel_mask
datasets.name: pixel_mask_index

datasets.doc: Pixel masks for each ROI: a list of indices and weights for the ROI. Pixel masks are concatenated and parsing of this dataset is maintained by the PlaneSegmentation
datasets.name: pixel_mask

datasets.doc: index into voxel_mask
datasets.name: voxel_mask_index

datasets.doc: Voxel masks for each ROI: a list of indices and weights for the ROI. Voxel masks are concatenated and parsing of this dataset is maintained by the PlaneSegmentation
datasets.name: voxel_mask

datasets.doc: The unique identifier for the rows in this dynamic table
datasets.name: id

datasets.doc: The vector columns in this dynamic table
The indices for the vector columns in this dynamic table

groups.doc: results for image segmentation of a specific imaging plane
Stores image stacks segmentation mask apply to.
One or more image stacks that the masks apply to (can be one-element stack)

groups.name: reference_images

links.doc: link to ImagingPlane group from which this TimeSeries data was generated
links.name: imaging_plane

attributes.doc: Value is 'Metadata about an imaging plane'
attributes.name: help

datasets.doc: Description of image_plane_X
datasets.name: description

datasets.doc: Excitation wavelength in nm
datasets.name: excitation_lambda

datasets.doc: Rate images are acquired, in Hz.
datasets.name: imaging_rate

datasets.doc: Calcium indicator
datasets.name: indicator

datasets.doc: Location of image plane
datasets.name: location

attributes.doc: Multiplier to get from stored values to specified unit (e.g., 1e-3 for millimeters)
attributes.name: conversion

attributes.doc: Base unit that coordinates are stored in (e.g., Meters)
attributes.name: unit

datasets.doc: Physical position of each pixel. COMMENT: 'xyz' represents the position of the pixel relative to the defined coordinate space
datasets.name: manifold

datasets.doc: Describes position and reference frame of manifold based on position of first element in manifold. For example, text description of anatomical location or vectors needed to rotate to common anatomical axis (eg, AP/DV/ML). COMMENT: This field is necessary to interpret manifold. If manifold is not present then this field is not required
datasets.name: reference_frame

groups.doc: One of possibly many groups describing an imaging plane. COMMENT: Name is arbitrary but should be meaningful. It is referenced by TwoPhotonSeries and also ImageSegmentation and DfOverF interfaces

attributes.doc: Value is 'Metadata about an optical channel used to record from an imaging plane'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Metadata about an optical channel used to record from an imaging plane

datasets.doc: Any notes or comments about the channel
datasets.name: description

datasets.doc: Emission wavelength for channel in nm
datasets.name: emission_lambda

groups.doc: One of possibly many groups storing channel-specific data COMMENT: Name is arbitrary but should be meaningful

links.doc: the device that was used to record from this electrode
links.name: device

attributes.doc: Value is 'Image stacks whose frames have been shifted (registered) to account for motion'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Image stacks whose frames have been shifted (registered) to account for motion

groups.doc: An image stack where all frames are shifted (registered) to a common coordinate system, to account for movement and drift between frames. Note: each frame at each point in time is assumed to be 2-D (has only x & y dimensions).

attributes.doc: Value is 'Reuslts from motion correction of an image stack'
attributes.name: help
attributes.value: Reuslts from motion correction of an image stack

groups.doc: One of possibly many.  Name should be informative.
Image stack with frames shifted to the common coordinates.
groups.name: corrected

groups.doc: Stores the x,y delta necessary to align each frame to the common coordinates, for example, to align each frame to a reference image.
groups.name: xy_translation

links.doc: HDF5 Link to image series that is being registered.
links.name: original
